Issues.Title: Despite setting DPI_AWARENESS_CONTEXT_PER_MONITOR_AWARE_V2 MessageBox are displayed blurred.
Issues.Body:
_This issue has been moved from [a ticket on Developer Community](https://developercommunity.visualstudio.com/t/Despite-setting-DPI_AWARENESS_CONTEXT_PE/10092129)._

---
[severity:It bothers me. A fix would be nice]
1st monitor: 100 %, primary
2nd monitor: 150 %

If you have the App window on the 2nd monitor where a MessageBox is displayed, it will be displayed blurred in the correct size. On the other hand, if the 1st monitor also has a scaling of 150%, the MessaageBox on the 2nd monitor will be displayed in focus.

This affects WPF apps with .NET Framework 4.8 under Windows 11.

So the MessageBox is always created with the scaling of the primary monitor and then stretched to the scaling of the 2nd monitor. However, it should work the same way as other dialogs, e.g. OpenFileDialog and FolderBrowserDialog.

---
### Original Comments
(no comments)

---
### Original Solutions
(no solutions)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Despite setting DPI_AWARENESS_CONTEXT_PER_MONITOR_AWARE_V2 MessageBox are displayed blurred." (#6775)

Issues.Title: MS.Internal.Invariant.get_IsDialogOverrideEnabled() can throw NullReferenceException
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: 6.0

I have only the exception stack trace collected automatically from one of my clients. No other system information is available.

I hope that this stack trace would be useful for some research.

According to [sources](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/blob/main/src/Microsoft.DotNet.Wpf/src/Shared/MS/Internal/Invariant.cs), IsDialogOverrideEnabled could throw NRE if registry key "Software\\Microsoft\\.NETFramework" is missing on the machine.

`System.NullReferenceException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object.
at bool MS.Internal.Invariant.get_IsDialogOverrideEnabled()

Issues.Title: [Accessibility Issue]: Narrator tool in Windows 11 is not able to read content there in RichTextBox control of WPF application.
Issues.Body:
* .NET Framework Version: 4.7.2
* Windows version: (Windows 11 21H2 (Build : 22000.739)`)
* Does the bug reproduce also in WPF for .NET Framework 4.7.2?: Yes
* Is this bug related specifically to tooling in Visual Studio (e.g. XAML Designer, Code editing, etc...)? If yes, please file the issue via the instructions [here](https://docs.microsoft.com/visualstudio/ide/how-to-report-a-problem-with-visual-studio?view=vs-2019). No
* Security issues and bugs should be reported privately, learn more via our [responsible disclosure guidelines](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/blob/main/README.md#reporting-security-issues-and-security-bugs).

 <!-- Read https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/blob/main/Documentation/issue-guide.md -->
 
 **Problem description:**
 Narrator tool in Windows 11 operating system is not able to read the text content available in paragraphs under RichTextBox control of WPF. However, this same text there in RichTextBox control is read by Narrator tool in Windows 10 21H2 OS.

Sample code for RichTextBox control used in our WPF application:
`<RichTextBox x:Name="AppContentRichTextBox" BorderThickness="0"
                                   x:FieldModifier="public" IsDocumentEnabled="True" IsReadOnly="True"
                                   FontSize="16" Foreground="Black" FontFamily="Segoe UI" 
                                     KeyboardNavigation.TabNavigation="Continue" Focusable="True"
                                   Margin="-5,0,0,30" AutomationProperties.Name="App content details"
                                   Visibility="Visible" HorizontalContentAlignment="Stretch" VerticalAlignment="Center">
                            <FlowDocument>
                                <Paragraph    KeyboardNavigation.TabNavigation="Continue" Focusable="True">
                                    This is the 
                                    <Bold> paragraph</Bold> text of the application which need to be read by 
                                    <Bold> Narrator tool </Bold> available in Windows 10 or 11 operating system.
                               </Paragraph>
                            </FlowDocument>
</RichTextBox>`

 **Actual behavior:** <!-- callstack for crashes / exceptions -->
 No exceptions. 
 Narrator tool in Windows 11 is not able to read content there in RichTextBox control of WPF application.

 **Expected behavior:**
Narrator tool in Windows 11 has to read content there in RichTextBox control of WPF application. 

 **Minimal repro:**
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[Accessibility Issue]: Narrator tool in Windows 11 is not able to read content there in RichTextBox control of WPF application." (#6771)

Issues.Title: Auto Width of TextBox doesn't fill Horizontal StackPanel correctly
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: .NET 6.0
* Windows version: 10
* Does the bug reproduce also in WPF for .NET Framework 4.8?: Yes
 
 **Problem description:**
If you create a StackPanel, with horizontal orientation, and put a textbox within it (with the default auto width) the textbox doesn't fill the Stackpanel, it defaults to a width of 6. With vertical orientation, the textbox fills the whole width.
 
 **Actual behavior:**
TextBox Auto Width is too small inside horizontal oriented StackPanel 

 **Expected behavior:**
TextBox Auto Width should fill the whole stack panel when using Auto width.
 
![example screenshot](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/31216671/177528983-b584acea-5d6c-4c28-b706-6df2c2399ce0.png)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Auto Width of TextBox doesn't fill Horizontal StackPanel correctly" (#6759)

Issues.Title: set PrintQueue.CreateXpsDocumentWriter owner
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version:5.0
* Windows version: windows 10
* Does the bug reproduce also in WPF for .NET Framework 4.8?: No
 
 **Problem description:**
 I showDialog in window 1 another window 2,
Call PrintQueue.CreateXpsDocumentWriter in new window 2
The printer selection dialog 3 popped up, 
but it can not set the Owner option, 
which caused me to accidentally click on the new window 2, 
and the printer selection dialog 3 was hidden to the new window 2. 
After that, 
it is expected that the new window 2 cannot be clicked.
XPSDocumentViewer has the same problem,
When the print button is clicked, the dialog box may be set to the back
 **Actual behavior:** <!-- callstack for crashes / exceptions -->
 
 **Expected behavior:**
 
 **Minimal repro:**
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "set PrintQueue.CreateXpsDocumentWriter owner" (#6768)

Issues.Title: WindowFromPoint malfunctions for x64 WPF application.
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: (6.0.202)
* Windows version: (Windows 11 21H2)
* Does the bug reproduce also in WPF for .NET Framework 4.8?: Test for 4.7.1 reproduced successfully.
 
 **Problem description:**
Native function `WindowFromPoint `  cannot be used to obtain handle to windows in x64 WPF application.  
When attempting to get a window from .NET WPF process(no matter it's a remote process or the current process), it returns the 'background' window as if the WPF window does not exist.  
This problem disappeared if  `PlatformTarget` property in '.csproj' file is set to x86(default x64 in the following project).
 
 **Minimal repro:**
[WpfApp1.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/files/9066344/WpfApp1.zip) in which is a draggable cross.
Dragging the cross to any point at the window itself does not work.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "WindowFromPoint malfunctions for x64 WPF application." (#6766)

Issues.Title: When applying large number of predicates to the RowFilter in DataView, it causes performance issue.
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: (e.g. 3.0 Preview1, or daily build number, use `dotnet --info`) 3.1.0
* Windows version: (`winver`)
* Does the bug reproduce also in WPF for .NET Framework 4.8?: Yes/No
* Is this bug related specifically to tooling in Visual Studio (e.g. XAML Designer, Code editing, etc...)? If yes, please file the issue via the instructions [here](https://docs.microsoft.com/visualstudio/ide/how-to-report-a-problem-with-visual-studio?view=vs-2019). No
* Security issues and bugs should be reported privately, learn more via our [responsible disclosure guidelines](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/blob/main/README.md#reporting-security-issues-and-security-bugs).

 <!-- Read https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/blob/main/Documentation/issue-guide.md -->
 
 **Problem description:**
 When applying a large number of predicates(i,e) 195 predicate values to the RowFilter in DataView, it takes almost 7-10 secs to filter the records in the DataTable collection.
 
 Note: For a simple sample, we have created predicates for 195, but we have a case to set 10k predicates to RowFilter for DataView.
 As per suggestion from the developer community, we have split the predicate using brackets. But it takes more time to filter the records.
 Link-https://developercommunity.visualstudio.com/t/when-applying-filter-in-datatablecollection-stacko/1003602
 
 **Actual behavior:** <!-- callstack for crashes / exceptions -->
 It takes more time to filter the records in DataTable.
 
 **Expected behavior:**
 The filter should apply to the DataTable, without any delay.
 
 **Minimal repro:**
1. Run the attached sample.
2. Click the `ApplyFilter` button to filter the records.
3.  Observe, that it takes more time to filter the records.

[WPF_Sample.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/files/9063117/WPF_Sample.zip)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "When applying large number of predicates to the RowFilter in DataView, it causes performance issue." (#6764)

Issues.Title: Setting LinearGradientBrush for more than one control not working properly
Issues.Body:
**Problem description:**

My requirement is to set the different color for bottom border as like below. So, I have used LinearGradientBrush for my requirement.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/92976485/177701762-04b8de8d-f9b1-4005-88c2-ddc8fd5f5c70.png)

I have a viewmodel with one LinearGradientBrush type property, then I have binded this property to many controls like TextBox, Button, RichTextBox etc  BorderBrush property. Binding same LinearGradientBrush property to many controls not working as excepted. 

Please find the sample and screenshot below:

[WPF-Application.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/files/9060848/WPF-Application.zip)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/92976485/177703408-8ecbb9c9-a8da-4ef8-80ee-a3491e10642a.png)
 
 **Actual behavior:** Binding same LinearGradientBrush property to many controls not working as excepted. 
 
 **Expected behavior:** Binding same LinearGradientBrush property to many controls should work as excepted. 

**Note:** I have checked with other platform like WinUI, this scenario works properly. Please find the sample regarding it below:

[WinUI-Application.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/files/9060857/WinUI-Application.zip)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/92976485/177703922-5555cb6b-3140-41a2-8114-dfca9e49143d.png)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Setting LinearGradientBrush for more than one control not working properly" (#6763)

Issues.Title: Fix filepath casing
Issues.Body:
Fixes dotnet/wpf#6725

## Description
Renames files and directories that do not match the path in the project files or that multiple projects references the same file with different casing.

## Customer Impact
Should fix issues with Source Link (Like dotnet/wpf#6725).

## Regression
No.

## Testing
Local build + CI.

## Risk
Low.

Issues.Title: ListBox.ScrollIntoView with grouping
Issues.Body:
- .NET Core Version: .NET 6.0

- Windows version: 10

- Does the bug reproduce also in WPF for .NET Framework 4.8?: Yes

**Problem description:**
`ListBox.ScrollIntoView` doesn't work with grouped collectionview.

**Actual behavior:**
Nothing happens

**Expected behavior:**
`ListBox` scrolls to object passed into `ScrollIntoView`
 
 **Minimal repro:**
[ScrollIntoViewMinRepro.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/files/9054956/ScrollIntoViewMinRepro.zip)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "ListBox.ScrollIntoView with grouping" (#6760)

Issues.Title: ScrollViewer (apparently) resets child Grid ColumnDefinition's to *
Issues.Body:
Hello,

See the following:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7372902/177523900-f7032653-3a7e-49d4-b296-2be6205586f0.png)
```xaml
<Grid Width="200" Height="200">
    <ScrollViewer VerticalScrollBarVisibility="Auto" HorizontalScrollBarVisibility="Auto">
        <Grid Background="Green">
            <Grid.ColumnDefinitions>
                <ColumnDefinition Width="50"/>
                <ColumnDefinition Width="*"/>
            </Grid.ColumnDefinitions>
            <Rectangle Fill="Red" Margin="5" Grid.Column="0"/>
            <Rectangle Fill="Blue" Margin="5" Grid.Column="1"/>
            <Rectangle Fill="Violet" Opacity="0.7" Grid.Column="0" Grid.ColumnSpan="2" Width="40" HorizontalAlignment="Left"/>
        </Grid>
    </ScrollViewer>
</Grid>

```

Inside a 200x200 Grid we have a ScrollViewer, which hosts a Grid where Rectangles are occupying their respective Columns.
A third Rectangle overflows through both defined Columns, the above XAML is fine, no issue so far.

However the moment I set the Width of the third Rectangle to a size greater than what the Grid hosting the ScrollViewer supports, for example 400, the ColumnDefinitions behave as if I had set both to "*", which is incorrect, it should show the Horizontal ScrollBar, make the Grid that is inside the ScrollViewer bigger where only the Column Index 1 inscreases in Width, while 0 remains with 50px Width.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7372902/177524341-36c50bae-fd3f-480b-86c5-49fa773945c3.png)

Seemingly in VS2019 it still shows in the Designer that 50 and 1* are attributed, but the behavior is as if both were 1*.
This happens in both the Designer and while running the application.

Is this a bug or is my assumption incorrect and it's behaving as intended?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "ScrollViewer (apparently) resets child Grid ColumnDefinition's to *" (#6758)

Issues.Title: Window.Close() does not close owned windows
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: 6.0
* Windows version: 20H2
* Does the bug reproduce also in WPF for .NET Framework 4.8?: Yes
* Is this bug related specifically to tooling in Visual Studio (e.g. XAML Designer, Code editing, etc...)? No

 <!-- Read https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/blob/main/Documentation/issue-guide.md -->
 
 **Problem description:**
Window.Close() closes non-owned windows as documented.

See:
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/api/system.windows.window.close?view=windowsdesktop-6.0
_Closing a Window causes any windows that it owns to be closed_
 
 **Actual behavior:** <!-- callstack for crashes / exceptions -->

- ShowDialog() not returns on Close().
- ShowDialog() returns on MainWindow close.

 
 **Expected behavior:**

- Owned windows are closed as documented.
- ShowDialog() returns.

 
 **Minimal repro:**
[WindowCloseBug.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/files/9053163/WindowCloseBug.zip)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Window.Close() does not close owned windows" (#6757)
